#Text=Gary M. Green
#Text=Gary M. Green ( born 20th century ) is a musician , author , television host , gaming consultant and entrepreneur . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ]
#Text=He was vice president of marketing for The Trump Organization [ 3 ] [ 4 ] and appeared on the television reality game show The Apprentice . [ 5 ]
#Text=He was also on the 2004 television special New Year 's Eve with Carson Daly . [ 5 ]
#Text=Green was executive vice president of Synergy Gaming , and the public face of the company . [ 4 ]
#Text=He was the spokesman for four years , until 2017 for Ortiz Gaming . [ 6 ]
#Text=In 2016 it was announced that he would host a television series called " Casino Rescue " . [ 7 ]

column1: #Text=Career
#Text=Music
#Text=Gary Green
#Text=Charlotte NC
#Text=Green recorded three folk-music albums from 1977 to 1982 with Folkways Records , which worked with other folk artists including Woody Guthrie and Pete Seeger . [ 3 ] [ 8 ] [ 9 ]
#Text=Folkways was later acquired by the Smithsonian Institution as part of the " Smithsonian Folkways " exhibition . [ 8 ]

column1: #Text=Green also composed music for the crime drama film Fort Apache , The Bronx ( 1981 ) . [ 5 ]
#Text=The film , starring Paul Newman and Ed Asner , is about life in New York City 's South Bronx from the point of view of a police officer .
#Text=Media
#Text=In the 1970s , Green was a journalist for The Gaston Gazette , a newspaper in Gastonia , North Carolina , which was later purchased by Halifax Media Group . [ 3 ] [ 10 ]
#Text=He earned two Pulitzer Prize nominations for his writing . [ 9 ]
#Text=In 2010 , he wrote Marketing Donald Trump , a guide explaining how Green marketed Trump which can be applied to other marketing applications .
#Text=In 2012 , he wrote Gambling Man , which details Green 's life as a modern-day casino boss through personal anecdotes . [ 3 ] [ 4 ] [ 11 ]
#Text=Other activities
#Text=In the early 1990s , Green purchased part of a Russian circus .
#Text=He established it as a Euro Circus attraction at Myrtle Beach , South Carolina . [ 12 ] [ 13 ]
#Text=After he sold the circus , he joined Smith-Gardner , a Florida catalog software company .
#Text=At Smith-Gardner , Green aided in development of software to take orders online when the company changed their focus from telephone and mail orders . [ 12 ]
#Text=Casinos
#Text=Gary Green and Donald Trump
#Text=By 1979 , Green was working with casinos in Atlantic City , New Jersey . [ 14 ] [ 15 ] [ 16 ]
#Text=He patented a casino-management system based on customer relationships . [ 17 ]
#Text=He was vice president of marketing for The Trump Organization and the Trump 29 Casino near Palm Springs , California . [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ]
#Text=Green was named president of Absentee Shawnee Gaming Enterprises in July 2004 . [ 2 ] [ 14 ]
#Text=He was general manager of the Thunderbird Wild Wild West Casino in Norman , Oklahoma [ 16 ] and oversaw construction of another casino in Oklahoma City . [ 18 ]
#Text=In 2005 , Green co-founded Las Vegas -based casino management and development company Southern Dutch Gaming with Frank Haas , [ 2 ] [ 19 ] who he worked with at Trump 29 . [ 18 ]

#Text=Green was general manager of Glacier Peaks Casino in Browning , Montana , in 2006 , [ 15 ] [ 20 ] [ 21 ] [ 22 ] and was hired by the Ottawa Tribe to oversee their new Four Winds Casino that same year [ 1 ] and consulted for an Ottawa casino in Miami , Florida . [ 16 ]
#Text=Synergy Gaming hired Green in 2009 as its executive vice president and official public face of the company . [ 4 ]
#Text=He purchased the former Gold Mine Casino in 2011 . [ 3 ]
#Text=Green served for four years as spokesman [ 23 ] [ 24 ] and senior consultant to the president for Ortiz Gaming . [ 6 ] [ 25 ]
#Text=Discography
#Text=Gary Green , Vol. 1 : These Six Strings ( 1977 )
#Text=Gary Green , Vol. 2 : Allegory ( 1977 )
#Text=Gary Green , Vol. 3 : Still at Large ( 1982 )
